hero.headline: Protecting Our Shores for Future Generations
hero.subheadline: The Coastal Conservation Alliance unites volunteers, scientists, and communities to preserve marine ecosystems through hands-on cleanups, education, and policy advocacy along the Atlantic coast.

services.headline: Our Programs
services.subheadline: Six core initiatives driving measurable change for coastal and marine ecosystems

items.title: Beach Cleanup Initiative
items.description: Organizing monthly community cleanups at 30+ coastal sites. We remove plastics, microplastics, and marine debris while collecting data that informs our policy work and tracks pollution trends over time.

items.title: Marine Education
items.description: Partnering with schools and community centers to deliver hands-on marine science curriculum. Over 8,000 students have participated in our tide pool excursions, coral workshops, and ocean literacy programs.

items.title: Policy Advocacy
items.description: Working with state and federal legislators to strengthen coastal protection laws. Our team has contributed to four pieces of environmental legislation including single-use plastic restrictions and marine sanctuary designations.

items.title: Wildlife Monitoring
items.description: Training citizen scientists to track nesting sea turtles, migratory shorebirds, and marine mammal populations. Our monitoring data feeds into national databases used by NOAA and the Fish & Wildlife Service.

items.title: Community Outreach
items.description: Hosting public lectures, film screenings, and seasonal festivals that connect people with our coastline. Our annual Shore Festival draws 5,000 attendees and raises awareness across the region.

items.title: Coral Restoration
items.description: Operating two offshore coral nurseries where we grow and transplant resilient coral species. Since 2019, we have planted over 3,000 coral fragments across degraded reef sections with an 82% survival rate.

items.title: Founded
items.description: Coastal Conservation Alliance incorporated as a 501(c)(3) by a group of marine biologists and concerned citizens in Wilmington, North Carolina.

items.title: First Major Cleanup
items.description: Organized our inaugural coastwide cleanup event, mobilizing 400 volunteers across 12 beaches and removing 8,200 pounds of debris in a single weekend.

items.title: Education Program Launch
items.description: Launched our Marine Education initiative in partnership with 15 local schools, bringing ocean science curriculum to 2,000 students in the first year.

items.title: State Partnership
items.description: Signed a formal partnership with the North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality, gaining access to protected research zones and state funding.

items.title: 100,000 Pounds Removed
items.description: Reached the milestone of removing 100,000 pounds of marine debris from coastal ecosystems since our founding, with data published in three peer-reviewed journals.

items.title: National Recognition
items.description: Received the National Environmental Achievement Award from the EPA and expanded operations to cover 150 miles of coastline across three states.

team.headline: Our Leadership
team.subheadline: Dedicated professionals leading the charge for coastal preservation

members.name: Dr. Elena Vasquez
members.title: Executive Director
members.bio: Marine biologist with 18 years of conservation experience. Former NOAA researcher specializing in coral reef ecology and coastal resilience. Leads organizational strategy and government partnerships.

members.name: Marcus Chen
members.title: Program Manager
members.bio: Oversees all six core programs and coordinates a network of 200+ active volunteers. Brings a decade of nonprofit operations experience from the Sierra Club and National Audubon Society.

members.name: Dr. Sarah Okafor
members.title: Research Lead
members.bio: PhD in Marine Ecology from Duke University. Manages our wildlife monitoring program and coral restoration nurseries. Published 12 peer-reviewed papers on coastal ecosystem health.

members.name: Jamie Rivera
members.title: Community Coordinator
members.bio: Leads volunteer recruitment, school partnerships, and public events. Grew our volunteer base from 2,000 to 25,000 over five years through grassroots engagement and social media outreach.

cta.headline: Join the Movement to Protect Our Coast
